content: Erk - sorry @Sean , just realized I left a test step-g conversion running on bz in a screen session from back in December that must have infinite looped (if you were wondering what that process was about...)

This is kind of cool - it's a Creative Commons - Attribution licensed model of a "traveling directly downwind faster than the wind" device. We can't quite import all of it - our importer doesn't like most of the propeller surfaces - but it does have a STEP file in the Assembly.zip file: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4897423
Any idea why it has trouble with it? Not solid, self-intersecting, too close to other faces??
thingiverse is awesome, I need to get my printer back up and running

Errors looked like this:

Srf1(110): shell based surface model
ON_Brep.m_T[9].m_type = ON_BrepTrim::seam but m_iso is not N/E/W/S_iso.
WARNING: shape_representation_relationship is not valid
m_object_table[0].m_object->IsValid() = false.
        ON_Brep.m_T[9].m_type = ON_BrepTrim::seam but m_iso is not N/E/W/S_iso.
